title: Design, synthesis, and in vitro and in silico study of 1-benzyl-indole hybrid thiosemicarbazones as competitive tyrosinase inhibitors
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,28524-28542
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA05015K, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Zahra Batool, Saeed Ullah, Ajmal Khan, Farhan Siddique, Sumaira Nadeem, Abdulrahman Alshammari, Norah A. Albekairi, Rimsha Talib, Ahmed Al-Harrasi, Zahid Shafiq
Developing new anti-tyrosinase drugs seems crucial for the medical and industrial fields since irregular melanin synthesis is linked to the resurgence of several skin conditions, including melanoma, and the browning of fruits and vegetables.
